Reviews.Title: Great Phone, Awesome Smart Phone, better and cheaper than Samsung or Apple iphone
Reviews.Author: Niraj Shah
Reviews.Content: Got this phone with a nice big screen as Apple iPhone but five times cheaper ($150 vs $750 for iphone). Facebook, Skype, Email, text messages, browsing the Internet and 4G Internet Connection are super fast. Wi-fi is really fast as well and phone never had any issues. I love this phone! Its the best phone I had. I even bought if for all my family members.

Reviews.Title: It works, but not all good.
Reviews.Author: Tsung
Reviews.Content: There are couple bad things of this Alcatel One Touch Fierce 7024W.1), the color of the LCD screen is very inaccurate. The white color looks light-blue.2), both the rear/front cameras are fixed focus. It always takes blurry images for most the cases. For example, if you want to take a photo of a check, and then deposit it electronically by uploading the photo to your bank. Forget about this model.3), the total internal memory is only 4GB. After the OS and Apps, it may only have 500MB for your own files. Well, if you only use it as a phone, doing text, emailing, online accounts, and watch stream videos like YouTube, it will be just fine. (however, if you want to store a lot your own files like songs, images, movies, then you need store them at the external micro SD card.)And the minor bad: no NFC, not removable battery.Other than above, it is a low-budget fast Quad-core 1.2GHz smartphone with 4G (HSPA+) data speed (not LTE), and very good to use everyday. It does not have any add-on and you will experience the very original Android v4.2.2.In addition, with T-Mobile WiFi Calling feature built-in that, for example, if you are in foreign country, you can use WiFi Calling that can call or receive just as you were in States without any roaming charge.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Inderjeet "indi"
Reviews.Content: Excellent cheap solution for my 13 year old. He can now have his music and hangout apps on his phone. He's very happy.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: tpowell
Reviews.Content: This is the second one we ordered because my wife's was stolen.  She could have gotten any phone she wanted, but she wanted this one again.  It's fast, has a good android OS and is clean looking.  It got here in two days flat on Prime along with the SanDisk Ultra I ordered with it!  Great product, amazon prime service!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the Hubby!
Reviews.Author: Amber Risteen
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my husband.  Was nervous about it not being one of the "better brands" but this phone has been absolutely perfect for him!  He loves it more than his tablet now!  :)

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Amber Riley
Reviews.Content: The phone was delivered on time and it has no problems. Great buy and I can let my daughter play with it because it is baby proof :)

Reviews.Title: nice phone little glitchy at times
Reviews.Author: Jake Gael White
Reviews.Content: let me start off by saying ive only had this thing for a day but if been using my brothers for about a week and its a very nice device it feels really solid in the hand it has a good amount of weight to it, and its very snappy through the homescreens and apps one thing you might want to get is a micro sd card as i found memory runs out fairly quickly with only 1.5gb of memory i liked the fact that i could also make it to where i could automatically download apps to my sd card. i have owned alot of devices over the past few years and this is one of my favorites ive owned iphones galaxys and this one touch fierce stands up there and surpasses them in many ways i am very impressed especially with it being so cheap

Reviews.Title: alcatel one piece touch
Reviews.Author: hadiza
Reviews.Content: This phone works just like iPhone and Samsung s4 loved it dose everything perfect I don't like spending huge amount o. Phone this is perfect I recommend to any one looking for luxury in decent pice I gave it 4 stars

Reviews.Title: lock screen
Reviews.Author: tariek griffin
Reviews.Content: the lock screen pages flash and glitch up sometimes but when i unlock my phone its fine, i dont know what it is

Reviews.Title: it is not samsung
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lauco11"
Reviews.Content: It is not samsung or iphone but it is as good. specailly when use wifi data, it is no diffrent then the name brand

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: MsYogi
Reviews.Content: I like the phone. The only problem that I find so far is with video recording. It records dark. The light pops in and out.

Reviews.Title: alcatel  phone
Reviews.Author: cliff tine
Reviews.Content: the phone is just the one I was looking for, it took only three days to be at my home.... thanks again  cliff

Reviews.Title: It's okay for a new user to Android - great price though...
Reviews.Author: JR San
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my mom since this was her first Android phone.  It's nice in some ways and not in others.  The resolution is ok, could be better.  The loud speaker is not that loud. Hard to navigate when you are used to a Samsung, so when i was teaching her i had a lot of trial and error, not to mention that the 411 number at the beginning of the Contacts is not able to be erased, which I do in case I (or she) should press it by mistake, and in doing so we did press 411 twice - cost us $4 extra in our cell bill.  It's an ok phone for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Very capable low budget smartphone.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "cys"
Reviews.Content: I bought T-Mobile version for my teenager daughter from eBay for $115, slightly cheaper than Amazon. At this price, I think it is one of most underrated cellphone. In its price range, it has virtually no competition, just like nexus 5, Moto g, lumia 521. I have virtually no complain except the subbar camera. 1G Ram plus quad-core CPU give it ample room to run most app except the most demanding ones. 4.5 in size LCD hit a sweet spot between oversized tablet-like phone and tiny 3.5in phone. Not the best quality, the qHD display is actually quite pleasant to ordinary eyes. Internal storage (4G) is too small for my taste, but many apps can be moved SD card, and these days $16 can buy you 32GB class 10 microSDHC, give you as much storage as many high-end phone. Out of box, there is 1.5GB empty storage left, which is better than I expect. It will drain about 8% to 9% battery if I leave it idle for one day, so standby time is pretty good.I haven't spent enough time with it to justify a 5-star rating. 4 for now, if it does not give me or my daughter any trouble in next three months, will come back and upgrade it to 5.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Machine Gun "MnVols"
Reviews.Content: I gave up my HTC Evo 4G so we could sign up for a family plan with T-mobile.  I didn't want to break the bank buying 5 new phones, so we either got the Alcatel One or the Nokia 521.  While I wasn't expecting it to be a top of the line smartphone, this thing is just plain cheap...damn I regret getting it.  Touch screen, camera quality, and the overall look and feel of the phone is not good. I will say the 1.2 quadcore cpu is pretty responsive and apps open fast.  That's about it; I hate this phone and will be taking it back to the store.  It's a good starter phone for a kid, so if they damage it you're not losing much.  If you've had a quality phone and go to this, you'll be in the same boat as me.  You get what you pay for, so beware should you buy.  It's a starterphone and nothing more/less.

Reviews.Title: Bought two: after a month one broke and the other malfunctioned
Reviews.Author: rafael jgp fiuza
Reviews.Content: I bought two of those for family members. Got myself embarrassed after a month when both phone started malfunctioning. One had a lot of bugs but worked. the other one the speakers didnt work, making it impossible to give/receive calls, use alerts and etc. I have them sent to the manufacturer for repair witch caused me some time wasted on mailing. It came back with the problem fixed if it wasn't for the new bugs that appeared. After a while dealing with bugs I decided to spend more money  to buy some real smartphone from the leading brand. It was a waste of tree hundred dolars for me, an expensive lesson.

Reviews.Title: This phone is a waste
Reviews.Author: happymj
Reviews.Content: I can't answer calls half the time... Dialing a phone number is almost impossible... If you have to push additional numbers after you are able to enter the correct number you are calling you might as well give up... I am so frustrated with this phone...

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Pamela Sams
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for three months and until a week ago it looked like it had come straight from the box - not a scratch. Then I noticed that it was no longer completely flat and over a couple of days it became more deformed so that there was quite  visible bend to the screen. Finally the screen came up looking broken rendering the phone useless.I did not drop the phone. I did not abuse it in any way. I went to Best Buy and got a new replacement as I had bought a 2 year warranty. The replacement phone was not flat so I handed it back. I'm on a third phone now - we'll see how it goes.By the way - much to my extreme annoyance, Best Buy did not honor the remainder of my warranty on the replacement phone and said if I wanted a warranty, I would have to buy a new one.Zero stars for phone, zero stars for Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone ever
Reviews.Author: Reggie Dennery
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone I have ever used or owned. I have had to return it under the warranty 7 times. This phone gives soooooooooo many problems. Do Not get this phone

Reviews.Title: Peice Of Crap
Reviews.Author: Westonyman
Reviews.Content: I gave it two stars cuz I loved it. I bought it in the middle of febuary. Now NO sound comes out of the speakers, and the title screen glitches out. This makes it impossibe to take calls unless you have headphones in. And with only 2g of storgage, theres not much u can get. Im writing the review off of my alcatel, so at least it works

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS POS
Reviews.Author: Leslie Simon
Reviews.Content: Purchased this POS the end of December 2013. Six weeks later I could not get an internet connection for hours. Restarted the machine. The screen went black & couldn't be restarted, useless. Due to my ignorance, and lack of information from the sales person, I paid in full $150.00.  When I brought the dead phone to my local TMobile store the sales person said that I was not entitled to a new phone by a different manfacturer because I paid in full. A solution was to purchase another phone or pay $20.00 and they would send me a new Alcatel phone. Two weeks later I received a new phone. Now out of pocket $170.00. Four weeks the new phone did the same thing. No internet connection, restarted, screen went black, wouldn't restart. Back to the local T-Mobile store, same drill $20.00 fee and a  new phone. Out of pocket expenses would be up to $190.00, and the same POS. I got exactly what I paid for. Should have researched customer reviews before purchasing this POS, I would not have purchased it. I read very negative reviews about T-Mobile's customer service regarding this problem. I decided to cut my losses at $170.00, research a replacement phone by a reliable manufacturer. Called T-Mobile customer service expection no help.  They could not have been more helpful.  I explained my experiences. Without a moment's hesitation I was credited $170.00.  I have an affordable plan with T-Mobile. Their customer service pulled through. I will keep TMobile as my provider and thoroughly research a different manufacturer and pay monthly for the new phone. Please do NOT purchase an Alcatel brand.

Reviews.Title: Not too awful, buuut...
Reviews.Author: Jonathan P
Reviews.Content: I've used this phone off and on for about five months.First, the good: speed is decent for such a cheap phone. There's some lag when launching more intensive programs, but it's consistent, unlike some other phones I've used that randomly hang for 5-10s at a time.-Battery life is also good; with wi-fi and cellular data off, it drained only 1% every 30m for me. (that's how I roll)-It's been reliable. And tough. I've dropped it numerous times (generally on hard surfaces), and I've never had it fail on me.The bad: the phone's a bit chunky, but hey, it's cheap. I only really have three bad things to say about it, but they're annoying enough to keep me from using the phone as anything more than a backup.-Screen accuracy. For whatever reason, it seems this phone doesn't always register my finger presses as having taken place quite where they actually did. This results in mis-taps when trying to launch apps and texting, and trying to use small interface elements (wee buttons and sliders). It's not huge, but it is noticeable and annoying. Possible I just got a poorly calibrated unit.-Camera. The color reproduction is fairly decent, but it's SO FUZZY. There's a lot of noise, and the lack of autofocus ensures that the noise is everywhere. Yes, that means you can't tap on the screen to make that part of the picture clearer. It is what it is, just like the no-focus cameras on the old feature and flip phones. They don't look too awful on the phone (see my next point), but once you upload them and look at them on a computer screen it becomes glaringly obvious.-Screen. There is ONE angle at which you can view the screen that makes it look passable; anything else, and it quickly degrades. It is terrible. This might be partly forgivable if the colors were right, but they aren't. Greens are ok, but blues and reds look purplish. I wound up using a monochrome wallpaper, because it was the only thing that looked decent.Bottom line: if you find a good sale on one of these, and don't mind the screen and camera being decidedly subpar, maybe it'd be worth it. But with the far better LG F3 not costing much more than this - and the excellent Moto G not much farther beyond that - I can't say I'd really recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Don't purchase this phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone mid January, worked well at first. Sunday I got a call after that the phone went dead. It never came back on, so it worked for 2 months. No phone for 2 days, then T Mobile sends another phone it doesn't charge at all.  I go thru tech support still won't charge. I had to pay $5 for the first phone being shipped, now they want to charge my account another $5 for a piece of scrap phone. I had to make a fuss to get that and to expedite the order at no charge. I have to wait 5days because they are on back order. The phone was only $150 which is still my hard earned money, but 2 months and now going on third phone. Recall this phone immediately.

Reviews.Title: Not a good phone!
Reviews.Author: Thea Pershall
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone from Target thinking that it seemed like a pretty good phone. Not even 3 weeks later it repeatedly shut itself down. I had to wait for it to run out of battery and then recharge it so I could turn it back on. Also, the phone would freeze up for hours at a time. I tried taking it to Target and they told me they couldn't exchange it since it was past 14 days, i called T-mobile and they said that even though it is through their company that they can't do anything since I didn't buy it from them and suggested that i send it to the company. The company is in texas and doesn't even have a phone number. I have never have had so many issues with one phone in my life

Reviews.Title: Camera quality
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: The camera quality on this phone is horrid. not only is there no auto focus, the front camera SUCKS! I do not recommend buying this phone if you enjoy pictures and such. but overall, the phone is okay. I bought an adorable case from amazon and I love the look of it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT GET THIS PHONE!!
Reviews.Author: Zora
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone at Walmart and started having issues  2 weeks later. First, it was the number pad. When I called a number with a menu, then dial a number to reach an extension, it doesn't work. I'm such a novice, I thought it was my fault, so I didn't return it. Then I started adding contacts. It wouldn't let me edit my contacts. Every time I would press on contact to edit it, it would call the person. I took the phone to Walmart and they had the same issue. I purchased Walmart's extended warranty, they said it is still under manufactures warranty, so I have to go through them. After coming here and reading users comments that he sent phone in and got one just as bad, I decided not to do that. That was before I got a voicemail for a job that I applied for ONE WEEK AFTER THE EMPLOYER CALLED ME!! I am always on my phone, and the message for the mail just popped up. It never showed me there was a message before! This wasn't a fluke, because just now I received a text two days after my sister sent it. I am going to get rid of this as soon as my replacement plan kicks in!

Reviews.Title: T-Mobile prepaid is misleading
Reviews.Author: Danny Newport "......Danny"
Reviews.Content: T-Mobile doesn't have a prepaid plan.  They only have postpaid plans so if you want a true prepaid plan and phone keep looking but if just paying as you go is fine then you may feel right at home.  The phone is a pretty decent phone but with only 2 megs of onboard memory you will be limited to what you install unless you add more to it.  The phone is pretty responsive to the touch and works pretty well but with the misleading consumers into thinking that the phone is prepaid using T-Mobile I can't give the phone a good rating as it doesn't sit well with me selling a phone as prepaid when the plan is truely only postpaid and you have to call T-Mobile in order to stop using the phone or you will get a charge long after you quit using the phone which is another hidden feature of the phone/service by T-Mobile.I liked the phone and had plans to stay with the phone and plan and give it to my Mother for Christmas last year only to get charged phone fees long after I stopped using the phone which I only needed it for a week while on vacation and figured on a prepaid phone so I didn't get any charges after I got home only to get a bill for $66 with only using the phone for a week and stashing it away until Christmas arrived and by then I wanted to use another carrier that actually and truely has a prepaid plan..when the plan stops the billing and service stops....hope this helps someone else so you don't get burned with a surprise bill.

ProductInfo.Features:
4.5 in qHD Display - a vivd screen for viewing photos, playing games and watchuing HD movies
Quad-Core Processor with 1GB RAM and 4 GB ROM & a Micro SD Slot for expandable memory
Android 4.2 - Jellybean
5 MB rear camera with LED flash and camcorder to capture, edit, create and share photos and videos in addition to a VGA front facing camera
Smooth multitasking experience allows you to simultaneously run multiple apps, games and access the internet
ProductInfo.Name: Alcatel One Fierce Prepaid Phone - Silver (T-Mobile)
